intro: Cynomarathrum scabrum, commonly known as the roughleaf cynomarathrum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
